adrFormatAddress: 620 8th Ave, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: Seattle-based coffeehouse chain known for its signature roasts, light bites and WiFi availability.

originalText.text: Very convenient system for paying for food. The employee at the entrance will explain to you how this system works. It's a little difficult the first time, but the next time you visit you become a pro ))) When you enter, you scan your card, choose what you like and exit through the turnstile and THAT'S ALL!!! Everything is very fast: I came in, I chose, I left.

originalText.text: Really great spot to work from with comfortable furniture and plenty of plugs and fast Wi-Fi. It‚Äôs a combo of Starbucks and Amazon Go.

text.text: Really great spot to work from with comfortable furniture and plenty of plugs and fast Wi-Fi. It‚Äôs a combo of Starbucks and Amazon Go.

originalText.text: Writing this review due to the barista Will (with the bucket hat) having an incredible customer service. Will notice that I was pressed for time because I had a meeting that was starting in 2 minutes and I still hadn't received my coffee and breakfast that I previously ordered. Will went out of his way to bring me my bagel and coffee where I was sitting (all the way in the back) so I didn't have to interrupt my meeting. Sometimes the littlest things make the biggest impact you guys should definitely give him a raise! Thank you again Will. ü§ó

originalText.text: The cafe is located in a tourist area; a fairly large flow of people comes into this small establishment. Nice interior, and you can also drink a glass of coffee with a good view, it looks cozy and makes you want to come back. But on Sunday it wouldn‚Äôt hurt to raise the salary (poor service and attitude towards clients, or probably the employees are not educated so that they don‚Äôt have much respect for people. I understand that working in such establishments is quite difficult, as well as a small salary... But when I stand in front of the cash register to order coffee on Sunday, the guy doesn‚Äôt respond to me, he couldn‚Äôt figure out the cash register, it takes a long time to prepare the coffee. I had to go to Starbucks on the next street, because this is not the first time I‚Äôve had a long wait, these people don't work for tips (terrible service, employees without motivation to work

originalText.text:
Great place to get your Starbucks coffee and bakery items. Not your usual Starbucks store as they have collaborated with Amazon Go, use your Amazon app to go inside the Amazon Go store to pick up items with cashless transaction. Scan your in store app to get in. Two restrooms available inside with plenty of seating.

Tip: Order ahead using your app as the place gets busy being in a corner with A subway entry/exit. Your name will appear on the board and state ‚ÄúReady‚Äù once it is available
